task.title: Editing source code using comment tags
task.shortdesc: Quick introduction to editing code with comment tags

context.p: Only edit HTML blocks when you know the website can run without it

step.cmd: Isolate the HTML code that you wish to edit out

substep.cmd: Space it out properly to ensure that you don't have messy code
Make sure that your replacement is already there.

step.cmd: Add the comment tag around the code that you wish to edit out
The code should be either grayed out or highlighted, depending on your text editor
From your computer, you should be able to compile the code and see that the information that you commented out is now missing
Disabling code is important. It helps you find errors in your code by process of elimination.
